oai_dc:dc.dc:title: May Day and June Day festivals at Peabody Colleges, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about the arts-related festivities on the lawn at Peabody College. The caption reads: “Corresponding to May Day celebrations will be the June Day festival to be held Tuesday afternoon, June 4, at 4 o’clock, on the lawns of Peabody College. Taking part in one of the dances are, left to right, above: Miss Juanell Walker, Miss Cherry Falls, Miss Emily Jones, Miss Nettie Lewis, Miss Janice? McTigue, Miss Billy Russell, Miss Janey Griffith, Miss Cathrine Schumacher, and Miss Joan Cordell.” Peabody was highly regarded as a school of education, especially in the South. The building in the background is the Social-Religious Building. Title supplied by cataloger. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: George Peabody College for Teachers
